SEARCH

Class Player

java.lang.Object
Player
public class Player extends Object
Represents a player in a game. Manages player information - IDs, names, and betting amounts. Player IDs are unique and automatically increment when a player is created, allowing players to have identical names.

  • Constructor Details

    • Player

      public Player(String name)
      Constructs a new player with a specified name. Initial chips are set to 1000.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the player

  • Method Details

    • placeBet

      public boolean placeBet()
      Places a bet by taking an amount input from the player. Amount is subtracted from the player's chips and added to their bet pool if they have enough chips.
      Returns:
      true if the bet is successfully placed, false otherwise.

    • placeBet

      public boolean placeBet(long amount)
      Places specified bet amount directly, updating the player's chips and bet pool.
      Parameters:
      amount - the amount of the bet
      Returns:
      true if the bet is successfully placed, false otherwise.

    • placeBet

      public boolean placeBet(int index, long amount)
      Updates an existing bet by index with an additional amount.
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the bet to update
      amount - the additional amount to add to the bet
      Returns:
      true if the bet is successfully updated, false otherwise.

    • addChips

      public void addChips(int amount)
      Adds a specified amount of chips to the player's total.
      Parameters:
      amount - the amount of chips to add
